intro: Anil burkeana, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive reddish bark and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are small, clustered, and often white or pink in color, while its fruit is a capsule that releases seeds when mature. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, Anil burkeana is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
